page.title: 01Land around Little Wisbeach
page.content: All the land is used for arable farming. there are around ten farms now in the block, and eleven houses. the land is flat with only a few trees and very few hedges. Several wide drains which take the water away to the forty foot drain to the east. part of the Carr dyke drain which was cut by he romans is still there. Most of the people who live in the block work on the land. One farm is a cereal plant breeding station. One farm yard is now a rabbit farm. The majority of the land is used for growing barley, wheat, rape and sugar beet. Two farms are part daily are arable. About half the land is owned by the crown, very little is rented, and the remainder is owned by the farmer.
